pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: @urkud We're so close to not needing it since we'll have a new feature in the next Lean release that supercedes it, but the idea with `{""}` is to continue a single interpolated string literal across multiple lines.
Are we waiting for something, or should we already merge it?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7243780594/job/19731125125)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7243780594/job/19731125376)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7243780594/job/19731125208)

```suggestion
          "and exist in order to ensure that \"complicated\" parts of the library are not " ++
```
To avoid `notaccidentally`

I think that `\n` at the end of the second line doesn't need to be there, since the error will be word wrapped, and having a newline in the middle of a sentence might be unexpected.

I'm not remembering whether string gaps have made it into the most recent Lean release yet, but this would be a good application of them:
```suggestion
      | throw <| .error n <| m!"Declaration {n} is not allowed to be imported by this file.\n\n\
          These invariants are maintained by `assert_not_exists` statements, \
          and exist in order to ensure that \"complicated\" parts of the library are not \
          accidentally introduced as dependencies of \"simple\" parts of the library."
```
It looks like `\` at the end of a line doesn't work. I'm going to revert to `++`.

@urkud That backslash at the end of the line wasn't a mistake. I forgot that this feature has not made it into the Lean release yet. It's just in the development version.

I'll push a working version.

```suggestion
      | throw <| .error n <| m!"Declaration {n} is not allowed to be imported by this file.\n\n
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: better error message for assert_not_exists
